classes.name: SQLite3
classes.desc: A class that interfaces SQLite 3 databases.

args.name: filename
args.desc: Path to the SQLite database.

args.name: flags
args.desc:
Optional flags used to determine how to open the SQLite database. By default, open uses SQLITE3_OPEN_READWRITE | SQLITE3_OPEN_CREATE.

SQLITE3_OPEN_READONLY: Open the database for reading only.

SQLITE3_OPEN_READWRITE: Open the database for reading and writing.

SQLITE3_OPEN_CREATE: Create the database if it does not exist.

args.name: encryption_key
args.desc: An optional encryption key used when encrypting and decrypting an SQLite database.

funcs.name: open
funcs.desc: Opens an SQLite 3 Database. If the build includes encryption, then it will attempt to use the key.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure to open the database.

args.name: filename
args.desc: Path to the SQLite database.

args.name: flags
args.desc:
Optional flags used to determine how to open the SQLite database. By default, open uses SQLITE3_OPEN_READWRITE | SQLITE3_OPEN_CREATE.

SQLITE3_OPEN_READONLY: Open the database for reading only.

SQLITE3_OPEN_READWRITE: Open the database for reading and writing.

SQLITE3_OPEN_CREATE: Create the database if it does not exist.

args.name: encryption_key
args.desc: An optional encryption key used when encrypting and decrypting an SQLite database.

funcs.name: busytimeout
funcs.desc: Sets a busy handler that will sleep until the database is not locked or the timeout is reached.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

args.name: msecs
args.desc: The milliseconds to sleep. Setting this value to a value less than or equal to zero, will turn off an already set timeout handler.

funcs.name: close
funcs.desc: Closes the database connection.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

funcs.name: exec
funcs.desc: Executes a result-less query against a given database.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the query succeeded, FALSE on failure.

args.name: sql
args.desc: The SQL query to execute (typically an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE query).

funcs.name: version
funcs.desc: Returns the SQLite3 library version as a string constant and as a number.

return.desc: Returns an associative array with the keys "versionString" and "versionNumber".

funcs.name: lastinsertrowid
funcs.desc: Returns the row ID of the most recent INSERT into the database.

return.desc: Returns the row ID of the most recent INSERT into the database

funcs.name: lasterrorcode
funcs.desc: Returns the numeric result code of the most recent failed SQLite request.

return.desc: Returns an integer value representing the numeric result code of the most recent failed SQLite request.

funcs.name: lasterrormsg
funcs.desc: Returns English text describing the most recent failed SQLite request.

return.desc: Returns an English string describing the most recent failed SQLite request.

funcs.name: loadextension
funcs.desc: Attempts to load an SQLite extension library.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the extension is successfully loaded, FALSE on failure.

args.name: extension
args.desc: The name of the library to load. The library must be located in the directory specified in the configure option sqlite3.extension_dir.

funcs.name: changes
funcs.desc: Returns the number of database rows that were changed (or inserted or deleted) by the most recent SQL statement.

return.desc: Returns an integer value corresponding to the number of database rows changed (or inserted or deleted) by the most recent SQL statement.

funcs.name: escapestring
funcs.desc: Returns a string that has been properly escaped for safe inclusion in an SQL statement.

return.desc: Returns a properly escaped string that may be used safely in an SQL statement.

args.name: sql
args.desc: The string to be escaped.

funcs.name: prepare
funcs.desc: Prepares an SQL statement for execution and returns an SQLite3Stmt object.

return.desc: Returns an SQLite3Stmt object on success or FALSE on failure.

args.name: sql
args.desc: The SQL query to prepare.

funcs.name: query
funcs.desc: Executes an SQL query, returning an SQLite3Result object if the query returns results.

return.desc: Returns an SQLite3Result object if the query returns results. Otherwise, returns TRUE if the query succeeded, FALSE on failure.

args.name: sql
args.desc: The SQL query to execute.

funcs.name: querysingle
funcs.desc: Executes a query and returns a single result.

return.desc: Returns the value of the first column of results or an array of the entire first row (if entire_row is TRUE), otherwise FALSE on failure.

args.name: sql
args.desc: The SQL query to execute.

args.name: entire_row
args.desc: By default, querySingle returns the value of the first column returned by the query. If entire_row is TRUE, then it returns an array of the entire first row.

funcs.name: createfunction
funcs.desc: Registers a PHP function or user-defined function for use as an SQL scalar function for use within SQL statements.

return.desc: Returns TRUE upon successful creation of the function, FALSE on failure.

args.name: name
args.desc: Name of the SQL function to be created or redefined.

args.name: callback
args.desc: The name of a PHP function or user-defined function to apply as a callback, defining the behavior of the SQL function.

args.name: argcount
args.desc: The number of arguments that the SQL function takes. If this parameter is negative, then the SQL function may take any number of arguments.

funcs.name: createaggregate
funcs.desc: Registers a PHP function or user-defined function for use as an SQL aggregate function for use within SQL statements.

return.desc: Returns TRUE upon successful creation of the aggregate, FALSE on failure.

args.name: name
args.desc: Name of the SQL aggregate to be created or redefined.

args.name: step
args.desc: The name of a PHP function or user-defined function to apply as a callback for every item in the aggregate.

args.name: final
args.desc: The name of a PHP function or user-defined function to apply as a callback at the end of the aggregate data.

args.name: argcount
args.desc: The number of arguments that the SQL aggregate takes. If this parameter is negative, then the SQL aggregate may take any number of arguments.

classes.name: SQLite3Stmt
classes.desc: A class that handles prepared statements for the SQLite 3 extension.

funcs.name: paramcount
funcs.desc: Returns the number of parameters within the prepared statement.

return.desc: Returns the number of parameters within the prepared statement.

funcs.name: close
funcs.desc: Closes the prepared statement.

return.desc: Returns TRUE

funcs.name: reset
funcs.desc: Resets the prepared statement to its state prior to execution. All bindings remain intact after reset.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the statement is successfully reset, FALSE on failure.

funcs.name: clear
funcs.desc: Clears all current bound parameters.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on successful clearing of bound parameters, FALSE on failure.

funcs.name: bindparam
funcs.desc: Binds a parameter to a statement variable.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the parameter is bound to the statement variable, FALSE on failure.

args.name: name
args.desc: An string identifying the statement variable to which the parameter should be bound.

args.name: parameter
args.desc: The parameter to bind to a statement variable.

args.name: type
args.desc:
The data type of the parameter to bind.

SQLITE3_INTEGER: The value is a signed integer, stored in 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 8 bytes depending on the magnitude of the value.

SQLITE3_FLOAT: The value is a floating point value, stored as an 8-byte IEEE floating point number.

SQLITE3_TEXT: The value is a text string, stored using the database encoding (UTF-8, UTF-16BE or UTF-16-LE).

SQLITE3_BLOB: The value is a blob of data, stored exactly as it was input.

SQLITE3_NULL: The value is a NULL value.

funcs.name: bindvalue
funcs.desc: Binds the value of a parameter to a statement variable.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if the value is bound to the statement variable, FALSE on failure.

args.name: name
args.desc: An string identifying the statement variable to which the value should be bound.

args.name: parameter
args.desc: The value to bind to a statement variable.

args.name: type
args.desc:
The data type of the value to bind.

SQLITE3_INTEGER: The value is a signed integer, stored in 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 8 bytes depending on the magnitude of the value.

SQLITE3_FLOAT: The value is a floating point value, stored as an 8-byte IEEE floating point number.

SQLITE3_TEXT: The value is a text string, stored using the database encoding (UTF-8, UTF-16BE or UTF-16-LE).

SQLITE3_BLOB: The value is a blob of data, stored exactly as it was input.

SQLITE3_NULL: The value is a NULL value.

funcs.name: execute
funcs.desc: Executes a prepared statement and returns a result set object.

return.desc: Returns an SQLite3Result object on successful execution of the prepared statement, FALSE on failure.

classes.name: SQLite3Result
classes.desc: A class that handles result sets for the SQLite 3 extension.
classes.footer:
public: void validate() const;
  public: p_SQLite3Stmt m_stmt;

funcs.name: numcolumns
funcs.desc: Returns the number of columns in the result set.

return.desc: Returns the number of columns in the result set.

funcs.name: columnname
funcs.desc: Returns the name of the column specified by the column_number.

return.desc: Returns the string name of the column identified by column_number.

args.name: column
args.desc: The numeric zero-based index of the column.

funcs.name: columntype
funcs.desc: Returns the type of the column identified by column_number.

return.desc: Returns the data type index of the column identified by column_number (one of SQLITE3_INTEGER, SQLITE3_FLOAT, SQLITE3_TEXT, SQLITE3_BLOB, or SQLITE3_NULL).

args.name: column
args.desc: The numeric zero-based index of the column.

funcs.name: fetcharray
funcs.desc: Fetches a result row as an associative or numerically indexed array or both. By default, fetches as both.

return.desc: Returns a result row as an associatively or numerically indexed array or both.

args.name: mode
args.desc:
Controls how the next row will be returned to the caller. This value must be one of either SQLITE3_ASSOC, SQLITE3_NUM, or SQLITE3_BOTH.

SQLITE3_ASSOC: returns an array indexed by column name as returned in the corresponding result set

SQLITE3_NUM: returns an array indexed by column number as returned in the corresponding result set, starting at column 0

SQLITE3_BOTH: returns an array indexed by both column name and number as returned in the corresponding result set, starting at column 0

funcs.name: finalize
funcs.desc: Closes the result set.

return.desc: Returns TRUE.
